text: my company is called Wireless car we do
IOT for the automotive industry our
company is based in Gothenburg Sweden
have offices in US and China as well and
we're about 300 people in total before
moving to the cloud our IT environment
was largely based on static on-premise
servers we were hosting big Oracle
databases and cheapest application
servers our initial business case when
moving to cloud was our test and
continuous integration and got this
delivery environment which needed a lot
of servers in in the peak hours of the
development time and our second business
case was when we started to launch our
micro services into production we also
needed a lot more services than we could
provide on on-premise we work with the
AWS support team by having monthly
workshops where we meet for two-three
days and work on different problems we
have findings they do to help us and
come up with solutions how to solve our
problems the relationship we have with
AWS support is totally different from
any other vendor we've worked with AWS
support really wants us to improve our
applications our utilization of services
and reduce the cost of our services
while other vendors it's more about
signing license agreements when
transitioning to the cloud and at the
same time delivering new capabilities to
our customers it's hard to keep focused
on everything that we had to do in order
to transition successfully this is where
a double support came in and helped us
with keeping track of costs keeping
track of optimization and new services
they've come out in AWS so that we could
optimize our deliveries moving into AWS
cloud has transformed the way we deliver
our solutions to our customers while we
were on Prem we were able
liver two to four times a year now that
we're in the cloud we deliver bi-weekly
when solving our issues rolling out our
automation into the cloud we used AWS
online support alerts and we used them
both for general guidance and for
support when things didn't work as we
expected the really positive experience
was using the general guidance where it
was like talking to an architect that
helped us solve our problems before we
even had them and then when we had an
incident or something happened we get
really timely help to solve the problems
and that's kind of a recommendation and
I usually say to people that I mean I
love iws services and the pace you guys
deliver but what I value the most is the
relationship we have with AWS
